perturbation.original_text: Payment IBM invoices will specify the amount due. Payment is due and payable by month end for any invoice received by the 10th of the month, otherwise payment is due thirty (30) days from receipt of invoice. Customer agrees to pay accordingly, including any late payment fees. Payment will be made in United States dollars.
perturbation.changed_text: Payment IBM invoices will specify the amount due. Payment is due and payable by month end for any invoice received by the 10th of the month, otherwise payment is due forty-five (45) days from receipt of invoice. Customer agrees to pay accordingly, including any late payment fees. Payment will be made in United States dollars.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the payment terms. Originally, if an invoice is not received by the 10th of the month, payment is due 30 days from receipt. Now, it is due 45 days from receipt, conflicting with the original payment term. This creates ambiguity in enforcement, as the exact payment deadline is now unclear.

perturbation.original_text: Additional hourly support Operational Assistance Per Hour $89.10 SmartHands (systems administrative and technical assistance) Per Hour $188.02 Operational DBA Per Hour; MS SQL $204.37 Charges for additional hourly support requested by Customer, if any, (support that is outside the scope of services included in the monthly recurring charges specified above) will be due as incurred. perturbation.original_text: Termination for Cause Customer or IBM may terminate this Agreement for material breach of this Agreement by the other upon written notice containing the specific nature and dates of the material breach.  The breaching party will have thirty (30) days from receipt of notice to cure such breach, except for nonpayment by Customer, which must be cured within five (5) days from receipt of notice. If such breach has not been timely cured, then the non-breaching party may immediately terminate this Agreement upon written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Termination for Cause Customer or IBM may terminate this Agreement for material breach of this Agreement by the other upon written notice containing the specific nature and dates of the material breach.  The breaching party will have fifteen (15) days from receipt of notice to cure such breach, except for nonpayment by Customer, which must be cured within ten (10) days from receipt of notice. If such breach has not been timely cured, then the non-breaching party may immediately terminate this Agreement upon written notice.
perturbation.explanation: The modification changes the cure period for material breaches from 30 to 15 days, and for non-payment from 5 to 10 days. This contradicts the original clause, introducing ambiguity and potential disputes regarding the time allowed to remedy a breach before termination can occur, and creating legal uncertainty and potential disputes over obligations.
